tool.name: AddImgCol2MapbyID
tool.displayname: Add Image Collection to Map by Asset ID

param.name: asset_id
param.displayname: Specify the image collection asset ID
param.dialogReference: The asset ID could be found at the dataset information page. For example, ee.ImageCollection('AAFC/ACI') loads the Google Earth Engine Image Collection by asset ID AAFC/ACI.

param.name: filter_dates
param.dialogReference:
The user can filter the image collection by starting and ending dates. The typical formats of date strings are listed below.

  1. Year only, '2020'

  2. Year and month, '2020-07'

  3. Year, month and date, '2020-07-01'

  4. Year, month, date, and time, '2020-07-05T06:34:46'

For more information, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/apidocs/ee-imagecollection-filterdate

param.name: filter_bounds
param.dialogReference: Filter a collection by intersection with point geometry. Items in the collection with a footprint that fails to intersect the given geometry will be excluded.

param.name: use_centroid
param.displayname: Use the center of the current map view extent
param.dialogReference: Use the centroid of the current map view as the point geometry.

param.name: image
param.dialogReference: The first 100 images will be listed here. To display the desired images, please narrow the date ranges and use filter by location. Select one image to add per run.

param.name: bands
param.displayname: Specify up to three bands for RGB visualization
param.dialogReference:
Choose up to 3 bands for visualization. You can choose

  1. One single band for visualization with color ramps

  2. Two bands for visualization with red and blue

  3. Three bands for visualization with red, green and blue

param.name: min_val
param.displayname: Specify the minimum value for visualization
param.dialogReference:
Specify the pixel value(s) to map to 0 (black).

Values are scaled to the 8-bit display range (0–255). For example, if band 1 ranges from 5 to 3000, setting min to 5 maps it to 0 (black), and max to 3000 maps it to 255 (white).

Use a single number for one band, or a comma-separated list for three bands (e.g., 0 or 0, 0, 0).

param.name: max_val
param.displayname: Specify the maximum value for visualization
param.dialogReference:
Specify the pixel value(s) to map to 255 (white).

Values are scaled to the 8-bit display range (0–255). For example, if band 1 ranges from 5 to 3000, setting min to 5 maps it to 0 (black), and max to 3000 maps it to 255 (white).

Use a single number for one band, or a comma-separated list for three bands (e.g., 30 or 30, 30, 30).

param.name: gamma
param.dialogReference:
Gamma correction adjusts perceived brightness. Use it to enhance contrast in specific tone ranges after mapping pixel values to 0–255. Gamma Values <1 lighten shadows; >1 darken highlights.

Use a single number for one band, or a comma-separated list for three bands (e.g., 1 or 0.9, 1, 1.2).

param.name: palette
param.displayname: Specify color palette in CSS-style color strings for visualization

param.name: out_json
param.displayname: Save the filtered image collection to serialized JSON file
param.dialogReference: Save the filtered image collection to a serialized JSON object for future use.

tool.summary:
This script adds the Google Earth Engine Image Collection to ArcPro as a base map by its asset ID. Please note that the dataset is added as a Tiled Map Service Layer, which is view only and cannot be edited. The user will need to download the dataset for analysis in ArcPro.

To browse all datasets, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/datasets/catalog.

For image visualization guides, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/guides/image_visualization

idCitation.resTitle: Add Image Collection to Map by Asset ID
